title: Apogee released 4 more games as freeware
content:
[url=http://www.apogee1.com]Apogee[/url] released as freeware today:
Bio Menace
The Thor Trilogy
Trivia Whiz
Word Whiz

Merry Christmas everybody!Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re:
content: Awesome. I was sort of feeling guilty about having just downloaded Bio Menace like some sort of pirate.

title: hehe
content:
I thoroughly enjoyed Bio Menace (and Monster Bash) episode 1... I felt the levels were paced in such a way as to introduce new challenges gradually, and yet reward players who knew what they were doing already. But with episodes 2 and 3, the whole pacing felt wrong, the level designs were less interesting, and the overall "cheap" factor added up.

I defy anyone to clear the first level in Bio Menace episode 3 without getting hit. Just try it. Those friggin' land mines are nearly impossible to see without randomly tossing grenades. Or do I just suck?

title: Hmm.
content:
I never got into the later episodes either. I think I made it across the first level in Episode 3, but I don't remember how I did it, nor whether I kept playing.

Seems to be the same way for alot of non-Keen oldschool shareware games. The first episode is mouthwateringly classy and lives in your memories as one of the greatest things to ever exist, and then you get the other episodes and they turn out to be the same old routine with slapped-together, reused ideas. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
Another game that comes to mind in that sense is Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure. I haven't played episodes 2 and 3 for a long time, but I remember that I found them quite difficult and didn't enjoy them nearly as much as Episode 1.

I was able to finish Bio Menace without cheats (I don't think there is actually a god mode cheat anyway...) but I agree 100% with what both of you are saying. Especially the insane difficulty of level 1 in episode 3.

It's still cool that Bio Menace is freeware now, though.--------------
